message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.NE, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of maintaining strongly connected components of a graph in the presence of failures, which is a fundamental problem in graph theory and graph algorithms. The paper uses a mixture of old and classical techniques such as the heavy path decomposition of Sleator and Tarjan and the classical Depth-First-Search algorithm, which are commonly used in the field of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also involves the computation of reachability and the study of the relation between strongly connected components and reachability, which are topics in graph theory and graph algorithms (cs.DM). The paper deals with the problem of fault tolerance, which is a topic in game theory and mechanism design (cs.GT) and network economics (cs.NE). The paper also involves the use of a data structure that is computed in a preprocessing phase, which is a topic in computational geometry and spatial data structures (cs.SI).
